modName: Breezehome Basement Redux - Hearthfire Compatible - DELETED
summary: This mod is a simple edit to the original Breezehome Basement Redux by Aelquias in order to make it compatible with Hearthfire.  No other changes have been made.
descriptionHtml:
[size=4]This mod is a simple edit to the original [url=http://www.nexusmods.com/skyrim/mods/10878/?]Breezehome Basement Redux[/url] by Aelquias in order to make it compatible with Hearthfire.  No other changes have been made.[/size]
[size=5]
[/size][size=4][color=#00ff00][size=5]** It does NOT require Hearthfire to function so will work fine for anyone without the DLC **[/size][/color]
[/size]
[size=4]This is my first mod, although I cannot take any credit for creating it as all the work was done by Ekki firstly and Aelquias latterly. All I did was to edit the cell navmesh data in TES5Edit to remove the CTD that would occur if you tried to enter Breezehome with the original Breezehome Basement Redux
mod and Hearthfire installed.

Special thanks to Aelquias for allowing me to upload this modified version.



Description from the original mod:[/size]

----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

[size=2][b]WHAT IS THIS MOD?[/b]

 This is the most realistic and laid back basement mod around. Inspired and based
 off of Ekkii's Basement mod, this basement is in the same foundational
 footprint as Breezehome above it. It is not large but any means but it
 is a space that you'd want to live in. You won't feel like you're
 cheating.

[b] This mod includes the Ekkii's Spouse Life mod addition. That means when you get married your spouse can work at the
 market stall and hang out in the basement.

 The mod works fine as a standalone as well for those not planning on getting married.[/b]

 The space is divided into two sections: The Workshop, and the Living Area.

 The Workshop includes an Anvil, a Workbench, a Tanning Rack, a Grinding Wheel, and an Enchanting Table. [b]Sorry, there is no smelter.[/b]

 The workshop is also the gear display area which includes two working
 mannequins, one male and one female. There is also two up-right weapon
 racks beside the mannequins and a display case by the Enchanting Table.

 There is a large chest and two barrels in the workshop for your crafting stuff or whatever you want to store there.

[b] By request there is now a magical 'safe' beside the Enchanter's table. It's super snazzy![/b]

 The second space is the Den slash Library slash relaxing zone. It has 4
 working book shelves. Two tall ones with 7 separate shelves combined.
 There is a custom-made 'Mammoth' shelf (credit to Ekkii) above the desk,
 and a lectern with a top display spot.

 There is one long fancy looking chest to hold nicer gear. There is a fancy strongbox on the desk
 perfect for notes, gems, and jewelry.

 I placed a new navmesh by hand and made an overall sweep of asset placement to make everything
 grid friendly and lighting friendly.

 There should be no shadow striping.

[color=#f4cccc][s][b] This mod is currently INCOMPATIBLE with the Hearthfire DLC. Sorry about that. [/b][/s][/color]

[b] Thanks to Ekkii, elgatoenlaluna and Thepal[/b]

 This mod is based primarily on the [url=http://www.nexusmods.com/skyrim/mods/9000/?]Breezehome Basement by Ekkii
[/url] mod.

 Thanks to Ekkii for giving me permission to upload this, and thanks to
 elgatoenlaluna for uploading the original mod and discussing things with
 me.

 Thanks to Thepal for letting me include the new actor based on his work.

[b] Is this mod OP?[/b]

 I don't believe this mod will break any sense of immersion or difficulty.
 Essentially this mod will allow you to not have to run up to Dragon's
 Reach to enchant or use the War Maiden's tanning rack or forge. You will
 still need to use their smelter though.

 There is no option to buy the basement from the Jarl's steward, but I feel the 5000 gp
 purchase price is enough of an investment of player's time to be
 rewarded with a working basement. In other words, if you buy Breezehome
 you get this standard. I may add the option to buy it later. If you
 really feel that bad you can always give away your gold :D

 This mod will work fine regardless if you have or have not bought Breezehome already.

 There is practically no saleable clutter, and no gear/treasure items pre-placed the character can use.

 The space has been beautified and made to look like someone wants to live
 there and does live there. I hope you enjoy your new basement.

 Thanks for checking it out![/size]

-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

[size=4]Original version of this mod [url=http://www.nexusmods.com/skyrim/mods/10878/?]Breezehome Basement Redux[/url]
Mod upon which the original version was based [url=http://www.nexusmods.com/skyrim/mods/9000/?]Breezehome Basement by Ekkii[/url][/size]
author: Stoneye1969
